page.title: 09JERSEY'S TIDAL RANGE
page.content:
The southeastern corner of Jersey at La Rocque, has the greatest low tide expanse of rock, shingle and sand in the island. The extreme range of tide is slightly in excess of 13 metres on exceptional spring tides that occur every few years. However, a range of almost 12 metres is common for several spring tides each years. At low spring tides it is possible to walk for more than 2 kilometres in a straight line towards Seymour Tower and not reach the low tide mark. The tide rises very rapidly and often surrounds rocks before covering them. Every year several people are cut off and have to be rescued and every other year or so someone is drowned here. {
{ Take Care}
